intro: Galium quichense, commonly known as Quiché bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Galium quichense is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and streambanks. It is a herbaceous perennial that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
